intro: Geoprumnon succulentum, commonly known as the desert stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white, typically during the spring or early summer. Its growth habit is low and spreading, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Geoprumnon succulentum is well adapted to full sun and requires minimal water once established.
